features: HYPOALLERGENIC: Our formula contains a milk protein that is broken down into tiny pieces to virtually eliminate allergic reactions in most babies who are allergic to cow’s milk protein
START FEELING BETTER TODAY: Similac Alimentum starts reducing colic symptoms due to protein sensitivity within 24 hours in most infants
WITH AN IMMUNE-NOURISHING INGREDIENT: First and only hypoallergenic formula with 2'-FL HMO, an immune-nourishing ingredient
SIMILAC IS THE #1 INFANT FORMULA BRAND FED IN HOSPITALS

EBT ELIGIBLE: Eligible to be purchased with Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits in select stores. The SNAP name is a service mark of the US Department of Agriculture. The USDA does not endorse any goods, services, or enterprises
body.description: Product Description Similac Alimentum infant formula with 2'-FL HMO is the first and only hypoallergenic infant formula with 2'-FL HMO, a unique immune-nourishing ingredient. It starts reducing colic symptoms due to protein sensitivity in most babies within 24 hours,† so your baby can start feeling better today.† * Due to protein sensitivity. † Based on a clinical study with Alimentum Ready to Feed without DHA, ARA, 2'-FL HMO, lutein, and beta-carotene. A crossover clinical study of infants experiencing colic symptoms due to cow’s milk protein sensitivity showed 5 of 6 infants initiated on Alimentum during the first week achieved a reduction in excessive crying. Data on File, Study AC84, August 2004. Abbott Nutrition, Columbus, Ohio. Brand Story By Similac

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Support for Baby’s Immune System Similac Alimentum with 2’-FL human milk oligosaccharide* (HMO) is complete nutrition designed to support your baby’s immune system. 2’-FL HMO is an immune-nourishing prebiotic like that found in breast milk. It is backed by more than 20 years of research. * Not from human milk.

Start Feeling Better Today* Similac Alimentum starts reducing colic symptoms due to protein sensitivity within 24 hours in most infants.* * Based on a clinical study with Similac Alimentum Ready to Feed without DHA, ARA, 2’-FL HMO, lutein, and beta carotene in a small group of infants experiencing colic symptoms due to cow’s milk protein sensitivity. Data on File, Study AC84, August 2004. Abbott Nutrition, Columbus, Ohio. Hypoallergenic and Is Suitable for Lactose Sensitivity Similac Alimentum has protein that is broken down into tiny pieces to virtually eliminate allergic reactions in most babies who are allergic to cow’s milk protein. It is suitable for lactose sensitivity and has DHA and ARA, special nutrients found in breast milk that are important to help support brain and eye development. Quality of Sleep After initiation of Alimentum, 62% of parents reported good to excellent quality of infant sleep vs 10% before initiation.* * Data on file. Similac Alimentum without 2’-FL HMO, lutein and beta carotene 2018. MySimilac Rewards With MySimilac Rewards, get nutrition guidance for you and baby, exclusive benefits, coupons, and much more.

Similac Alimentum Similac Pro-Sensitive Similac Pro-Total Comfort Similac Soy Isomil Suitable for Lactose Sensitvity ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Hypoallergenic for Cow's Milk Protein Allergy ✓ Has 2'-FL HMO for Immune Support ✓ ✓ ✓ Complete Nutrition for Sensitive Tummies ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Partially Hydrolyzed Whey Protein for Easy Digestion ✓ Soy-based Protein ✓ Not for infants or children with galactosemia ✓ ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Something that worked, finally!
reviews.reviewText: This is great stuff. Even if the powder did not work for your child, the ready to feed could be the answer as the ingredients are different.This is the only product my infant is able to use. We spent hours researching after trying other hypoallergenic formulas after we were unable to breastfeed because of a severe allergic reaction even after I cut dairy out of my diet. We saw some improvement on neutramigen but only minor. We finally tried this stuff and within two days she was a happier baby. Within a few weeks her skin was cleared up and her tummy troubles were nonexistent. Her acid reflux improved because this formula is a little bit thicker/heavier than the powder. She still uses this at 6 months. We use about one 32 oz. container per 24-30 hours.Yes- it’s expensive. Yes it’s inconvenient to tote around a bottle in a cooler if we go anywhere, and to heat all her bottles as she refuses cold milk. But- it is absolutely worth every penny for our child to finally feel better and be comfortable and thriving. This certainly was not our ideal feeding plan, but we have had to adjust and to accept that in our case, breast milk definitely was not what was best for her, unfortunately. This was our last resort before trying prescription formula Elecare or something similar. I am definitely glad we gave this one a shot before going that route.Occasionally we get similac coupons in the mail. Otherwise I order 6 at a time from prime pantry and use my amazon rewards card for 5% cash back, making it cheaper than getting at a big box store when I don’t have a coupon. So far everything I’ve gotten from prime pantry has been recently manufactured, the expiration date has been 10-12 months from the date of purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hypoallergenic baby formula
reviews.reviewText: So all my babies have a milk protein intolerance and I tried Nutramigen but after 3 weeks it made my baby’s stool watery no stomach cramp or bad gas just watery to the point it would run out the side of his diaper. It was a constant mess. Tried Enfamil simply plant soy formula and then it was the opposite after 5 days it made his poop like Playdo and he was in pain. So switched him to Similac Alimentum and all symptoms subsided. Price is cheaper than Nutramigen and more than Simply Plants. Only hassle is since it’s ready to use it needs to be refrigerated after opening. And when traveling extra steps are needed to make sure it doesn’t spoil.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for a sensitive stomach baby
reviews.reviewText: I was searching for a baby milk that my granddaughter can tolerate and didn't make her stomach upset it was recommended from her pediatrician. Amazing results my granddaughter is a happy baby 🍼

reviews.reviewerName: My son loved this set. It looks just like photo and great quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2022
reviews.reviewText: With the similac Alimentum RECALLED, I bought several cases for my great granddaughter. expensive but we true 11 formulas for her excessive acid reflux, vomiting etc. Alimentum worked! It is so convenient for me to make her a bottle. Personally since Similac caused the Alimentum bacteria Recalled formulas, these should be discounted.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars SAVED US FROM SLEEPLESS NIGHTS
reviews.reviewText: Our daughter was solely breastfed until my supply decreased so I decided to supplement with Similac pro sensitive. I thought being sensitive would give us less issues than the regular formula. Nope. Our daughter had projectile vomit, screaming poops (when she could go) and sleepless nights. I thought we were doomed until we discovered the alimentum formula. My daughter now poops regularly, sleeps normally and no longer has bouts of projectile vomit. This product is a life saver

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Alimentum? I hardly knew em!
reviews.reviewText: If you're a parent with a child that needs formula this product could be helpful to you *if* you've tried the more readily available and less expensive products like those labeled "sensitive" and those for gas but your son or daughter still is having problems. We went through all those options over a period of about a month (waiting a week or more to allow the child to adjust to the new formula), and none of them worked. Some, like the soy formula, actually made things worse for our daughter. So we decided to take out a second mortgage and try Alimentum.Thankfully, Alimentum works for her, and we are happy that we didn't have to try one of the other elemental formulas that is only available in powder form. Of course no one enjoys the price tag on these bottles, but the price is identical to the price of the local big box store in my area. The main reason we buy this through Amazaon and not a local retailer is convenience. Local retailers only stock 4-6 of these bottles on their shelves, and rather than hunt for an employee to search in back to bring up more every trip we just buy 19 of these from Amazon and pay the $5.99 shipping fee. It's also great that it comes to our door, so it's easier to unpack.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars RTF worked my twins
reviews.reviewText: After trying several formulas for my 4 month old twins, my pediatrician recommended similac alimentum. We initially started with the powder formula, but found it still made my little ones a little fussy. Although not as much, they’re were still a bit fussy. After researching we decided to try the ready to feed, and the fussiness went away! From what I’ve read the difference between the RTF and powder is corn. There is no Corn in the liquid and I think that’s what attributed to my girls calming down. It is a bit pricey and with 2 to feed you wonder if there are alternatives ,but we only bave a few more months before we introduce solids so my husband and I will manage.
